FuncDef:
The binding interface time-slot command binds timeslots or sub-timeslots to a flexible Ethernet (FlexE) Client. The bound timeslots constitute bandwidth of the FlexE client.
The undo binding interface time-slot command unbinds timeslots or sub-timeslots from a FlexE client.
By default, no timeslot is bound to a FlexE client, that is, the default bandwidth is 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface type.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.

Specifies an interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.

Specifies a list of timeslots with the 5 Gbit/s granularity to be bound.
The value is a string of 1 to 199 characters.
A timeslot list is continuous, consecutive, or hybrid. A continuous timeslot list uses an en dash (?). For example, 1?20 indicates timeslots 1 to 20. A consecutive timeslot list uses a comma (,) for separation. For example, 1, 5, 7. A hybrid list uses both symbols. For example, 1?3, 5.
The bandwidth of a physical interface in FlexE mode determines the ID range of timeslots with the 5 Gbit/s granularity:
For a 100GE physical interface in FlexE mode, timeslot IDs must be in the range 0 to 19.

Specifies a list of sub-timeslots.
The value is a string of 1 to 9 characters.
A timeslot list is continuous, consecutive, or hybrid. A continuous timeslot list uses an en dash (?). For example, 1-3 indicates sub-timeslots 1 to 3. A consecutive timeslot list uses a comma (,) for separation. For example, 1, 3. A hybrid list uses both symbols. For example, 1-2, 4.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind one or more 5 Gbit/s timeslots of a physical interface in FlexE mode in a FlexE group or one or more sub-timeslots in a 5 Gbit/s timeslot to a FlexE client, run the binding interface time-slot command. The bound timeslots or sub-timeslots constitute bandwidth of the FlexE client.
Prerequisites
A physical interface in FlexE mode has been added to a FlexE group using the binding interface command.
To bind sub-timeslots with the 1 Gbit/s or 1.25 Gbit/s granularity, ensure that the sub-timeslot granularity has been set to 1 Gbit/s or 1.25 Gbit/s using the set flexe sub-time-slot granula command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
